attributes.action: state in public his fullest support and gratitude for General Sir Richard Dannatt's contribution as Chief of the General Staff;  apologise to General Dannatt, the British Army and the British people for the treacherous briefings against General Dannatt; identify those ministers, MPs and special advisers/civil servants responsible for such briefings and remove them from government, the Labour Party or the Civil Service.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: General Sir Richard Dannatt is an inspiring and devoted Chief of the General Staff with the utmost concern for the soldiers serving under him.  It is disgraceful that, in a time of warfare, there are briefings against the General from government sources.  This should be termed treason or subversion as it will damage morale.  The Prime Minister should take responsibility and apologise for these briefings, provide General Dannatt with unqualified fullest support, and identify and remove those responsible for these briefings from their posts in government or in the Labour Party.
attributes.creator_name: Flight Lieutenant Iain S Paton RAF (Retd)
